args:
When the spiritree is felled, the forest withers
and dies, but Yggdrasil lives on as a sprout.
Isaac swears to pass on the lessons of this
conflict to future generations while searching
for a new way to preserve traditions of the past.
It will take far more than that!
Both of you, stop a minute and look!\nYggdrasil isâ€”
The forest of Initio has withered away...
Then Yggdrasil's life has ended. All is\nlost: our past, and our future with it.
I'm sorry, Isaac... But this isn't over yet.
Even if Yggdrasil dies, even if these woods\ndecay and the holy land is lost...
Initio's people live on. Your traditions are\nstill alive and well inside you, aren't they?
You said yourself that those traditions are\nthe wisdom of those who came before you.
As long as someone still holds those\nteachings in their memory, then tradition\nis never really lost.
Perhaps revering the past doesn't have\nto mean keeping a way of life unchanged\nforever.
Perhaps it fell on us to ensure that our\ninviolable laws did not twist themselves\ninto something harmful to today's world.
I suppose the work of thinking about that\nis part of our responsibility as those who\nwalk the earth today.
Maybe that's what it really means to\npreserve tradition.
Isaac persuaded the other natives of Initio to spare\nLuca from any punishment for his actions...
But we left the holy land early the next morning.
And how could we stay? Their precious forest was\ndead, and we were essentially its murderers...
(Usually when we fight, we've made up\nbefore we even realize it, but...this time\nfeels different.)
You two would be wise to bridge the rift\nbetween you before it grows impassable.
If I said I was entirely without anger,\nit would be a lie. Fury, grief, regret...\nMy emotions are as a storm within me.
But I cannot languish in inaction.\nThat much is clear to me.
Okay, Luca! Enough dancing around it.\nLet's just get it out of the way and make\nup already.
Ahhh. I feel like a new woman!
Thank you, Isaac. I'll never forget what I\nlearned here.
Your traditions, your way of life,\nand your way of protecting them both.
Those things will live on in my heart,\nlong after I leave this place.
Then it seems you have accomplished\nyour purpose in Initio.
Me too, Isaac. I'm so sorry...\nAnd thank you.
We never wanted to hurt Yggdrasil, and we\ncertainly never knew the whole forest\nwould wither.
We wanted to save our home and our\nfamilies. I swear that was our only\npurpose!
But in exchange for saving our town, we've\ntaken something priceless away from all\nsylvans.
What of your families?\nAre they well?
Yes... We made the remedy from the\nleaves, and...
Then Yggdrasil has granted its blessing to\nyou as well.
I assumed the spiritree's boughs would die\nwhen brought beyond the forest's reach...
Nothing. Pay me no mind.\nI am glad they have recovered.
Please know that neither I nor my people\never wished for anyone to die in place of\nthe forest. Nor did Yggdrasil, I'm certain.
We both had something we wished to\nprotect, and that brought us into conflict.\nNothing more.
Yup! We've still got a lot to think about\nand learn from, but neither side was\nreally the bad guy here.
Wise words. There you have it, gentlemen.\nYou are absolved. Let us speak of it no\nmore.
Please, let us help in restoring the forest.
We like our town and our way of living...
But we haven't forgotten our pride as\nsylvans, the children of the woods.\nLet us do our part!
I would appreciate that greatly,\nmy brother.
(I hope the beautiful forest of Initio really\ncan grow back here someday.)
Huh? Isaac? Where are you going?!
He went white as a sheet. I'm going\nafter him! What about you guys?
The landscape's changed so much that\nit's hard to say, but... I think so, yeah.
Ah, there he is. Isaac!\nWhat are you doing?
What's that you've got?\nSome kind of sprout?
I thought it died and disappeared.
It did not leave us. It merely lost its power\nand returned to this nascent state.
It spoke to me on the wind.\nAnnounced its presence here.
Yggdrasil's alive... That's so great!\nAre you guys all seeing this?!
Yeah. But when it grows back, do you think\nwe're doomed to repeat all this again...?
I won't let that happen. As a guardsman\nof the verdure, I swear it.
I will pass our experiences on as\nteachings for future generations to\nlearn from.
But I will not stop there. I'll find a way to\nensure that Yggdrasil does not become a\nsource of harm in times to come.
I will seek out a new way to protect our\npast amid a changing present.
Because protecting the past and protecting\nthe future are both important.
Let's all rise to that task together this time,\nso that none of this has to happen again!
Right. We'll be sure to do our part.
(Did you welcome Sarisse and Luca into\nyour bosom knowing this would happen?)
(In your boundless generosity, you\nsacrificed yourself to ease the strife\nthat divided your children.)
Let all of us sylvans protect the past and\nfuture we share together.
Though we may live different lives led\nby different values, we are siblings stillâ€”\nall children of the wood.
Let us walk the path before us together,\nwith the pride of the sylvan race in our\nhearts!
I hope all sylvans can find common ground\nunder the shade of one proverbial tree,\nliving and laughing hand in hand!
